item.title: Liquidity Is Everything: Why Most Markets Fail
item.description: After building prediction markets for 18 years, I've learned one truth above all others: liquidity is everything. Not technology, not UI, not even regulatory approval. Without liquidity, you're just running an empty casino. Here's what I've learned about why most markets fail and how to build ones that survive.
item.author: jason@smarkets.com (Jason Trost)
item.content:encoded:
After building prediction markets for 18 years, I've learned one truth above all others: liquidity is everything.

Not technology. Not UI. Not even regulatory approval. Without liquidity, you're just running an empty casino where nobody wants to play.

I've watched dozens of prediction markets launch and die. The pattern is always the same: grand vision, impressive technology, regulatory fanfare, then... silence. An empty order book. Wide spreads. Users who visit once and never return.

Here's what I've learned about why most markets fail and how to build ones that survive...

item.title: I've Survived Three Prediction Market Booms. Here's What's Different This Time
item.description: 2008, 2016, 2024. Each prediction market boom promises to revolutionize how we understand future events. Each one has ended the same way. As someone who's been building through all three cycles, let me tell you what's actually different this time—and what dangerously isn't.
